Episode 2 - Dynasties of Death

The story of the French Ã¢â‚¬ËœbourreauÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ is perhaps the most remarkable in the history of judicial executions. Nowhere were executioners more shunned than in France. Since they were carrying out the KingÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s work, by divine right, they were seen as mystical figures. Holy but unclean. It was nigh impossible for them to carry out any other trade. Episode 3 - States of Death

In Britain it was the rope. In France; the guillotine.
